column5: WOW WAS IT COLDER OUT THEN I THOUGHT!! A WEST WIND WOULD OF BEEN NICE(AT OUR BACKS) BUT SHE WAS NORTH EAST (RIGHT IN OUR FACES). WATERS WERE PRIME AND TOO MY AMAZEMENT FISH WERE JUMPING!! ALMOST LOOKED LIKE 1 FROZE IN MID AIR  LOL GOT 2 IN AN HOUR AND THAT WAS IT FOR ME!!! COULDNT HANDLE THE COLD ANYMORE!!!BURNING CHEEKS AND TOES AND HANDS I WAS DONE!!! IT WAS THAT COLD THE ROE WAS FREEZING UP INSIDE MY JACKET!!LOL  SNOW COMIN TONIGHT SO IM GONNA STAY HOME AND THAW  LOL SEE YA ALL AT THE SHOW!!
way to go CC,  as usual even catching bows in -30 windchill,you are a machine man for catching those bows like you do..  ..cheers
Awesome stuff Scott!!!!  Hope you didn't get frostbite out there!! Great work for a few short hours.
Brave man.. must of been brutally cold out in the open.   Bet those fish were stiff in seconds.
man you are a trooper! Good work on those fish.
Well done CC, good see you braving the elements, it's tough casting with frozen fingers !!

Scott, You are deffinitely the river trout MASTER my friend....the MASTER! I'm biding time right now trying to make this beer last a mite longer before I have to go out and quarter my new wood supply....Dang, it was just the day before yesterday I cut it to length. Think I'll only cut a 3day supply is all................these ears F-R-E-E-Z-E real quick. Keep up the great reports Scott....I think everyone loves 'em Bud!
TX ALL!!! AS FOR WORK I WORK HARD ENOUGH IN THE SUMMERS SO I DONT HAVE TO WORK WINTERS!!! NOT MY FAULT YA PICKED THE WRONG CAREER  LOL
I am amazed you found enough slush free water to put a bait in! Too tough for me... -34 windchill is extreme!
